bboxes.raw_text:
Vacationers, business travel
ers, "Sunday" drivers (even
when it's only Saturday, are out
on the highways in full force. AS
an aid to motorists, the Sentry
Safety Council of the Sentry In
surance companies has compiled
these safe driving tips:


Have your car safety checked.
Lights, tires, steering, brakes,
exhaust system, wipers, horn,
should all be in safe condition.
Leave DRIFTING to astronauts.
Install and use seat belts.
"Hold your horses" on super
highways. Beware of tendency


to speed up.


. Keep whole traffic scene in
view-watch all objects for
block ahead in town, half a
mile in country.


Tailgating is dangerous. Drop


back at least one car length for


each ten miles of speed.
. Before changing lanes, make


sure another driver isn't start

NEW YORK-Author James Bald
win has listed ten literary works
which he thinks helped him ma
ture. He believes literature is one
way of breaking through the con-
fines of ghetto life. This list Is
being distributed to schools and
Libraries in the country.


A tale of Two Cities, Dickens;
Crime and Punishment, The Pos
sessed and The Brothers Kar-
manzov, Dostoevsku: Portrait Of
a Larry, Henry James; The Mes
senger, Wright: Invisible Man,
Ellison: Black Boy. Wright: Prin-
cess Cass Amassina, James; and
Uncle Toms Cabin, Stowe.

Bold win Lists


Books To Reed

A new RCA Victor 'Vintage
Series" created to bring to the
public recordings Of historic and
artistic importance not available
for some years, was introduced
by RCA Victor Records this June.
June.


Comprised of carefully selec-
ted performances by great per-
sonalities of the popular, jazz and
folk music worlds, the series will
serve as a highly valuable the
saurus of collector items"
spanning the full history Of the
recording industry.

Showcased among the first four
albums in the Vintage Series is
the widely acclaimed "Body and
Soul, the Jazz Autobiography Of
Coleman Hawkins"


AS an added feature Of the new
series, playing time has BENIN
creased with Vintage albums Of
ten containing the equivalent Of 10
rather than IL selections. All
recordings in the series will have
been re-mastered with the latest
recording techniques, but the ar
tistic values Of the performances
will be the only consideration for
inclusion.

ing to pass you.


Pull to the right and stop when
you hear a siren or see flash
ing red light reminds the
Sentry Safety Council.


Everyone knows dangers of
driving while under influence
of alcohol. Users of drugs like
"pep pills, tranquilizers, anti
histamines, are a threat to safe
ty. Ask your doctor about driv-
ing after taking medication.
. If something goes wrong with
your car, pull off highway;
raise hood; tie white cloth on
door nearest road.


Always make sure your driv-
er's license is up to date and
your insurance Identification
card is tucked in your billfold
Finally, the Sentry Safety
Council says you never drive
alone. Your passengers, people
in oncoming cars, cars you pass,
pedestrians who cross your path,
family members at home, all de-
pend upon yomr driving actions.
